Key Match Events: Aaron Wiggins hit a 3-pointer to tie the game early in the second quarter
The Thunder dominated from there, outscoring the Rockets 41-20 the rest of the period to take a 75-51 lead at halftime
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder showed why they lead the league in defensive rating when they shut down Houston's top two scorers, Jalen Green and Alperen Sengun
Oklahoma City's depth and versatility were too much for the Rockets
Holmgren, in particular, was a problem on both ends. The 7-footer had three blocks and constantly affected Houston's shots near the rim
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder shot 51.1% from the field and made 20 of 23 free throws
Dillon Brooks scored 17 points for the Rockets, who shot just 43.3% from the field
Others: The game was a season-high point total for a half
The Thunder host Golden State on Sunday night
